P007858.project_name: Small Farmer Credit and Rural Development Project

keywords.cdata: affiliates,agricultural production,agricultural products,Agricultural research,Agriculture,agronomy,alternative use,Balance Sheets,bank lending,Banking Law,banking system,beef,capital constraints,capital costs,cassava,cattle,cattle diseases,Central Bank,commercial banks,Commodities,consolidation,consumer price index,cotton,cropping,crops,debt,drainage,economic justification,Economic Rate of Return,education,equipment,expenditures,exports,extension,extension services,external auditors,farmers,farms,feasibility studies,fertilizers,financial institutions,FISCAL YEAR,foreign banks,foreign exchange,forestry,GDP,growth rate,health,Imports,Income,incomes,Inflation,infrastructural investments,infrastructure investments,interest rate,interest rates,labor force,Land Reform,Land Use,land value,lands,legislation,Livestock,m2,maize,market prices,MARKETING,operating costs,population growth,potatoes,poultry,productivity,rice,Rural Development,Rural infrastructure,social services,soybeans,swine,technical assistance,timber,transport,UNDP,vegetables,water supply,wheat,wholesale prices,working capital

project_abstract.cdata: The project would: (a) include a lending program over a three-year commitment period to about 2,000 small farmers for on-farm investments and working capital; (b) improve the road system by providing finance for the purchase of an earthmoving unit for the construction and maintenance of 250 km of earth roads, the construction of bridges and culverts for these earth roads, and the construction of about 60 km of all-weather roads; (c) provide schooling facilities for farmers' children through the construction of 26 primary schools providing some 102 classrooms; (d) make available better health facilities by constructing and equipping two health centers and by financing the purchase of equipment for an already built health center; and (e) encourage community development by constructing three community centers.
